FuncDef:
The prefix-priority command sets a convergence priority for IS-IS routes.
The undo prefix-priority command restores the default value. The prefix-priority command sets a convergence priority for IS-IS routes. The undo prefix-priority command restores the default value. By default, in IP routing table, the priority of IS-IS host routes and default routes is high; the convergence priority of the other IS-IS routes is medium.
CLIs: prefix-priority [ level-1 | level-2 ] { critical | high | medium | very-low } { ip-prefix <prefix-name> | tag <tag-value> }
undo prefix-priority [ level-1 | level-2 ] { critical | high | medium | very-low }

ParaDef.Info:
Sets a convergence priority for Level-1 IS-IS routes.
-

Sets a convergence priority for Level-2 IS-IS routes.
-

Sets the convergence priority of IS-IS routes to critical.
-

Sets the convergence priority of IS-IS routes to high.
-

Sets the convergence priority of IS-IS routes to medium.
-

Sets the convergence priority of IS-IS routes to very-low.
-

Specifies the name of an IPv6 prefix list to filter routes. You can set a convergence priority for the IS-IS routes that match the specified IPv6 prefix list.
The value is a string of 1 to 169 case-sensitive characters.

Specifies the tag value to filter routes. You can set a convergence priority for the IS-IS routes with the specified tag value.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295. There is no default value.

ExtraInfo: When a routing table has a large number of routing entries on an IS-IS device, it takes a long time to implement the SPF calculation on the device. The prefix-priority command can be used to allow some key routes to be preferentially calculated.
